news_header: Crude oil prices continued to decline, hitting a one-month low due to increased U.S. oil production and rising inventories.
news_original_title: Oil Prices See Further Downside As Trump Reiterates Pledge To Boost Production
news_text: Crude oil prices fell further on Thursday, with March delivery dropping $0.42 to $70.61 a barrel, following a previous decline. President Trump reiterated his commitment to boosting U.S. oil production to lower prices, contributing to the downward pressure on oil. Additionally, a stronger U.S. dollar and a report indicating a significant rise in crude oil inventories by 8.7 million barrels last week added to the decline, surpassing economists' expectations of a 3.2 million barrel increase.
